block.p: WESTERN GAS RESOURCES, Denver, which gathers and processes gas, sold a gas-gathering pipeline system in eastern Oklahoma's Arkoma Basin to an undisclosed buyer for $10.5 million.

STROUDS INC., City of Industry, Calif., a bed and bath linens retailer, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection after an internal reorganization failed to stem losses. Strouds officials said they would close nine stores.

PG&E CORP., San Francisco, owner of California's largest utility and a national power seller, said it had agreed to buy a 500-megawatt power plant being built in central Mississippi from Duke Energy. The purchase price was not disclosed.
WACHOVIA CORP., Winston-Salem, N.C., the fourth-largest bank in the Southeast, said it would buy DavisBaldwin Inc., a closely held insurance broker based in Tampa, Fla. Terms were not disclosed.
